channel.title: Help with this Null Problem
channel.description: I have a major null problem. It occurs when someone attacks an npc and then X's the client. In the run log this repeats itself... [code] java.lang.NullPointerException at NPCHandler.AttackPlayer(NPCHandler.java:770) at NPCHandler.process(NPCHandler.java:357) at process.run(process.java:19) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) [/code] Can anyone tell me how to fix this.

Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 1 error Finished! item.title: Help with this Null Problem
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

Move these lines,

		if (server.playerHandler.players[Player] == null) {
			ResetAttackPlayer(NPCID);
			return false;
		} else if (server.playerHandler.players[Player].DirectionCount < 2) {
			return false;
		}

So it’s the first thing under this line

int Player = npcs[NPCID].getKiller();

Read full topic

item.title: Help with this Null Problem
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

Yes, but look at it. It’s checking the player AFTER it’s trying to do something.

		if (server.playerHandler.players[Player] == null) {
			ResetAttackPlayer(NPCID);
			return false;
		} else if (server.playerHandler.players[Player].DirectionCount < 2) {
			return false;
		}

Should be the first line(s) but after this line,

int Player = npcs[NPCID].getKiller();

Read full topic

item.title: Help with this Null Problem
item.dc:creator: @Z0D14C Z0D14C
item.description:
@Z0D14C wrote:

[code]
public boolean AttackPlayer(int NPCID) {
if(npcs[NPCID].getKiller() == 0){
return false;
}
int Player = npcs[NPCID].getKiller();
if (server.playerHandler.players[Player].attacknpc == NPCID) {
server.playerHandler.players[Player].faceNPC = NPCID; // zcheez: sets npc index for player to view
server.playerHandler.players[Player].faceNPCupdate = true; // zcheez: updates face npc index so player faces npcs
server.playerHandler.players[Player].attacknpc = NPCID;
server.playerHandler.players[Player].IsAttackingNPC = true;
}
if (server.playerHandler.players[Player] == null) {
ResetAttackPlayer(NPCID);
return false;
} else if (server.playerHandler.players[Player].DirectionCount < 2) {
return false;
}
client plr = (client) server.playerHandler.players[Player];
int EnemyX = server.playerHandler.players[Player].absX;
int EnemyY = server.playerHandler.players[Player].absY;
npcs[NPCID].enemyX = EnemyX;
npcs[NPCID].enemyY = EnemyY;
if(Math.abs(npcs[NPCID].absX - EnemyX) > 20 || Math.abs(npcs[NPCID].absY - EnemyY) > 20){
ResetAttackPlayer(NPCID);
}
//if(EnemyX != npcs[NPCID].absX && EnemyY != npcs[NPCID].absY) {
//npcs[NPCID].viewX = EnemyX;
//npcs[NPCID].viewY = EnemyY;
//npcs[NPCID].faceToUpdateRequired = true;
//}
int EnemyHP = server.playerHandler.players[Player].playerLevel[server.playerHandler.players[Player].playerHitpoints];
int EnemyMaxHP = getLevelForXP(server.playerHandler.players[Player].playerXP[server.playerHandler.players[Player].playerHitpoints]);
//if(EnemyX != npcs[NPCID].absX && EnemyY != npcs[NPCID].absY) // Xerozcheez: stops client crashing
//plr.viewTo(npcs[NPCID].absX, npcs[NPCID].absY); // Xerozcheez: Player turns to npc

            if(server.playerHandler.players[Player].attacknpc == NPCID) {

server.playerHandler.players[Player].attacknpc = NPCID; //the player attacks back when npc follows
server.playerHandler.players[Player].IsAttackingNPC = true; //the player attacks back when npc follows
FacePlayer(NPCID, Player);
}[/code]
That it?

Read full topic

It occurs when someone attacks an npc and then X’s the client.
